title: British father arrested for 'beating six-month-old daughter to death in Kazakhstan'
text:
A British man has been arrested in Kazakhstan for beating his six-month-old daughter to death.

The man, who has not been identified, allegedly attacked the girl in a room at the five-star InterContinental Hotel in Almaty last Thursday in front of her mother.

Police were called when the woman ran down to the lobby screaming for help, prompting hotel staff to rush to the room.

A British father has been arrested and accused of punching his six-month-old daughter to death at a hotel in Almaty, the largest city in Kazakhstan (scene pictured)

Aliya Dauletova, head of the hotel's sales department, told Tengri News: 'The hotel staff provided the necessary first aid.

'The ambulance rendered resuscitation to the child, restored pulse and pressure, and the child was hospitalized.

'We later found out that she died in the hospital.'

The man was arrested and is currently in police custody charged with 'murder of a person known to be in a helpless state, as well as involving the abduction of a person or hostage taking.'

Police were called to the InterContinental Hotel in Almaty on Thursday last week after the girl's horrified mother ran into the lobby and screamed for help

Police have not revealed a possible motive for the killing, and have not disclosed any information about the family.

A spokesman for the Foreign Office said: 'We are in contact with police in Kazakhstan following the death of a British child and the arrest of a British man in Almaty.'

A pre-trial investigation is underway. It is not clear when the man will make his first court appearance.
description: The Briton was arrested at the InterContinental Hotel in Almaty, Kazakhstan's largest city, on Thursday last week after allegedly beating his six-month-old daughter to death in one of the rooms.
